channel.title: What is an "Update Server"?
channel.description: Title, I've always wanted to know, according to what I've read its a good thing for the server to have.

item.title: What is an "Update Server"?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

here you can view code for better understanding (if you’re competent enough in java to understand it)

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/downloads/235685-jagcached-open-source-update-server.html

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/downloads/411453-multi-revision-update-server.html

Read full topic

item.title: What is an "Update Server"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Docent:

Ahh thats it? I was suspecting it was something to do with routinely saving the players every set period of ticks and saving all players when server is shut down.

I’ve never seen an update server used like that, nor how it could be implemented as such. You’re just thinking of a timer to save all players. That’s a poor way to do so, players need to be saved after doing actions and such, and force save when they disconnect. All players are to be saved when the server itself is being updated (Ex the ::update command).

Read full topic

item.title: What is an "Update Server"?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well, from my knowledge. The “Update Server” is what the client connects to as it’s first loading, as it connects it downloads new data, such as cache files. The rest of the data is typically server sided. Unless you have a downloadable client, there’s no other reason for the update server. If you do have a downloadable client, the update server would send out a message saying (or prompting) that you need to get the newest client.

Read full topic
